name: Hard Rock Hotel San Diego

reviews.text: I was so majorly excited for the Hardrock trip to San Diego. I rushed my 51 year old mother to our room ASAP because I thought I booked us the primo Gold level Rockstar Penthouse as seen on the website. The agent over the phone explained a very impressive room with balcony and jacuzzi bathtub. The pictures online looked amazing! Little did I know that each penthouse is totally different in size and the ones pictured are the largest/nicest and most expensive for each level. We get there, and they have one agent checking guests in. We waited. We checked in. Balcony was a ledge with a railing. My mom couldnt even fit on the "balcony". When booking the room I informed the agent that I would be taking my 51 yr. old Mom here for her birthday and I wanted to stay at the Hardrock because it was the coolest looking hotel. No one over the phone or at check in informed us that all of the Rockstar penthouses were directly above the nightclub or warned us about the noise level. So we didn't sleep. Music til 1:30 AM and drunk screaming the rest of the night. The room service guy even commented on how loud the rooms are and how many guests complain that they cant sleep in the Rockstar suites. He also literally laughed at how the rooms look nothing like they do on the websute. We checked out disapointed in the whole stay. I went to pay my credit card and I was charged twice for our room. Was also charged $130 in false minibar charges. I stay in hotels weekly and I have never ever had this happen. I was even charged for a "pleasure kit"...um, NO! Lucky after making a few phone calls the charges are suppose to be removed but so far hasn't reflected my credit card. Needless to say- WHAT A BUMMER. The hotel looked so cool. I did love to art and furniture. The Aveda bath products are of course a plus. But I would have traded Aveda and cool factor over sleeping and not having to be stressed out about the huge overcharge.
reviews.title: Stayed one night, paid for two along with $130 in false minibar charges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have are San Diego locals, and have been to the Hard Rock a few times. The decor is very hip and modern. The hotel staff courteous, young and attractive. Most staff members are college students who do not have a long term investment in the job. This type of staff is fun and energetic, but has little interest in the job of solving guest issues. Every time we were next to the front desk, multiple parties were having room and service issues. It seems that a manager is very hard to locate.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, good staff, Great for Party Time!

reviews.text: This is a very nice new hotel if you are looking for an All Night Party. The hotel floors are always full of guests on party nights. People book a room hand have large groups pack in to the rooms. There are rules about how many people and limits on outside alcohol, but these are not enforced by the staff. Do not get me wrong, this place is fun, it feels like Las Vegas. It will keep you up all night. Lucky for us locals, we can just go back home and get some sleep. I did feel bad for other guests from out of town who selected this hotel for a vacation and not a bachelor party. There are much better vacation spots in the same area. I have to give it a poor rating as a hotel.
reviews.title: love love love

reviews.text: Im very pleased with my saty @the hard rock before i decide to stay in this hotel i check tirp advisor review and it was not look good at all , so i took the chance to find out my self and it was the most incredibe stay in SD professional staff we were so happy with the every think .I had the pleasure to meet the assistant director BRYIAN GADD when my flight was cancelld so i wont to stay later than my check out he was so nice that he did every thing he could to make his gust happy and pleased thank u bryian i really appreciate it from the housekeeping to the valet parking .I will definitely go back all the time i dont have to look for another hotel lool i know where to stay ,
reviews.title: Most fabulous stay at this incredible property that offers it all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and 13 other girlfriends heading down to SD for some fun in the sun. Everyone at the Hard Rock made our stay enjoyable. Located perfectly within walking distance to all the action plus offers their own yummy food and hip clubs, you can not go wrong. The poolside cabanas are a must and don't worry if you stay up too late the beds are so comfy you will be able to sleep until noon. Overall at 10+!
reviews.title: Simply awsome hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Hard Rock and we had an amazing time! After reading some other reviews I was worried about some things but everything was great. When we first checked in we got upgraded which was really nice and the check in process was quick and easy. Our room was amazing and had an awesome balcony, we had a hard rock suite. We rented a car one day to go up to Temecula to visit some vineyards and the customer service was very helpful and got a car for us through enterprise. We thought all the staff was very helpful and told us some great places to go. We ate dinner at Donovan's one night which is a great steakhouse right next door and we went to the Marriott which there is a bar on the top floor and if there is a baseball game going on you can watch it because the bar looks down to the field. Breakfast was amazing in the hotel at Maryjane's and there are computers you can use free of charge with a printer! All restaurants, bars and shopping are all walking distance from the hotel. The San Diego Zoo is only like a 5-10min taxi ride away and the zoo was amazing. A couple of negative things about this hotel is that it is right next to the train and the train runs all night so it was noisy in the morning (but its the city so i guess we expected some noise) and there are so many taxes added to your room rate when you check out so beware on adding about $30 extra a day in taxes!!
reviews.title: Amazing Stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would deff. recommend this hotel to anyone and can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: A classy hotel with professional staff and great location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hard Rock twice: once for 3 nights and once for 4 nights. The staff are professional, friendly and prompt - from the check-in desk, to Ground Control (Operator), to the valets. The rooms are very modern and the beds are soooooooo comfortable - I am almost fraid no other hotel I go to will live up to that anymore. And I've seen quite a few hotels both on business and leisure. They have extra high thread count sheets and excellent mattresses. Flat screen TV was great, with good sound system. Especially like the little reading lamp on each side of the headboard - very effectively focused light.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, the staff made the difference
The ultimate in service, style, quality and overall perfection
reviews.text: It was great to be able to just walk out any night and be in the Gaslamp Quarter for our evening's entertainment. And whenever we drove, the valets put 2 bottles of water in our car and offered directions to wherever we wanted to go. The staff got stressed out during busy times like their summer pool party, but even then remained very accomodating and professional - while waiting for our room they allowed us to freshen up in the spa, and catered to many other requests. Their pool bar area is really well done - breezy and well appointed with couches / lamps / stools. The bartenders are friendly and know their cocktails. I live in Geneva, Switzerland and the fancy rooftop bars here pale in comparison.

And the Hard Rock is definitely better than the W any day - the decor is much classier and there is actually a pool at the pool bar. Definitely a great place to party and for those on business travel, right in front of the Convention Center so extremely convenient..
reviews.title: For those who wish to party, the Hard Rock is for you...

reviews.text: On check-in no ethernet cable for computer, told front desk, said someone would come up with one, nobody did. Eventually found a cable in a black felt pouch behind a sex kit for sale by Hard Rock placed in each room. Charged $270 per night, plus mandatory $17 per day for phone/internet access. Multi-media system advertised, TV didn't work, phone only worked on speaker phone. Hotel so noisy I was awakened at least four times by trains, hotel is directly next to railroad tracks. My employees said drunk people going up and down halls all night doors slamming. Hotel has no parking lot for customers, told only lot around is $19 per day and won't be able to get out if a baseball game is on. Our vendor parked in a lot a couple blocks away for $3 per day. Told hotel manager of deceptive practices. He said I was incorrect, lot was not $3 per day. Then with his security team in my room trying to fix TV and phone while I am on speakerphone with him, I tell him I am holding the $3 parking ticket. He tells me I am still wrong. Then says attendent must have made an error. Then I tell him it is an automated machine, check in on 15th out on 16th for $3. Then he changes story to we can't be reponsible for what other lots charge. Really? Then your staff should say they are $19. Valet didn't even want to let us unload if we weren't going valet. Told staff TV didn't work in morning still not fixed at night. We said we were checking out a day early, were told we would have to pay anyway. I said I was told 24 hour advance notce and we could cancel, they said early checkout pays additional night. Manager Luke angered me so much we left at 10:30 PM, got back to LA 1 AM. My employee then drove home, fell asleep at wheel, hit curb on freeway, two flat tires, CHP response. Now I have to pay three nights for myself and two employees who stayed one fatigued night plus pay my employees car repairs. Fortunately my employee wasn't injured. Hotel customer relations manager Luke accused me of lying. Thinks I said we coldn't sleep just to get out of paying for third night. This is a hotel for loud drunk kids. I will never stay in another Hard Rock Hotel. BTW still have $3 parking ticket disputing all charged with American Express.
reviews.title: Stayed one night, Hard Rock made me pay for three

reviews.text: Modern, trendy, cool and rockin' are all accurate when describing the Hard Rock San Diego. This place screams "look at me" with two great bars, a great pool deck and rock music blaring throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Vegas vibe and the price tag to go with it

reviews.text: The weekend pool and bar scenes mirror that of Vegas with lines, bouncers and trendily dressed/barely dressed patrons.
reviews.title: Why go to Vegas

reviews.text: The rooms are very modern and cool with HD flat screen TVs, audio and video inputs for iPods and cameras and a great mini bar with seating. The "Rock Star" suites are incredible with private balconies, a living room and full size bar.
reviews.title: Overpriced - Chic look, poor service

reviews.text: The front desk service is fine...unless you need help at 2:00am when there is no one to be found. The Valet staff was very quick and friendly.
reviews.title: We fell in love with the room – and then Maryjane’s.

reviews.text: If you are young and looking for action this is the place for you, but if you are 45+ I really wouldn't recommend it. No happy hour, no coffee machine in the room but plenty of alcohol. Second floor view is awful and not worth the money. If you are going to a Padres game great location, otherwise the traffic can be awful. Also if there is a party you can't use the pool, so really not a very relaxing place and prices are high.
reviews.title: not your place if you are 45+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i recently stayed the hard rock hotel and i was so dissappointed by the staff. they were rude, unhelpfull and they charged me twice for my room. when i noticed they told me it was sunday and there is nothing they can do about it!!!! i have a new baby and this is extreamly hard for me as a struggling mother. i stayed at the hard rock for my birthday and i left in tears, as the managers brushed me off and told me that they hope my next stay there would be better. trust me there will never be another stay, which it is very sad because i love the hard rock in chicago and las vegas. my only point is the service was so bad i will never return agaim or recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: worst birthday i have ever had

reviews.text: A few girlfriends and I were planning a trip to San Diego for a concert. I was a little hesitant at first because i never stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel before. When we got there we were greeted by the valet parking attendants who were very kind and helpful throughout our whole stay. If we had any questions or concerns they would gladly help us. We walked in for check-in it was pretty fast. I didn't know what to expect because apparently someone was checking in at 530 and their room wasn't ready yet. It was barely being cleaned. I hoped that wouldn't happen to me and it didn't. We got our keys they asked us what kind of music we preffered, til this day i dont understand why they asked us this. Anyway as we went up to our room the halls were decorated with rock n roll memorabilia it was very beautiful. We get to our room, (by the way we reserved a double queen bed hard rock suit), We were so amzzed by the decoration it was very chic, a couch, a lounge chair, 2 flat screen tvs, a fully stocked mini bar with two bar chair facing a large mirror, a blacony with a mid view of the surrounding shops. I loved that we turned up the music on those flat screens as loud as we could without being reprimended for it like other hotels do. I didn't really get to see the pool and the cabanas. By the way we arrived on a Wednesday so it wasn't a big party ambience. The hotel was near walking distance from everything from coffee shops, bars, lounges, ice cream, restaurants, to cigar shops. Checkout was quick you ould check out from the guest services on the flat screen tvs. Overall it was a very good experience. I thought the concierge attendants could of been a little more enthusiastic and helpful. Instead we relied on the valet attendants!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was planning my wife and I seven year anniversary and I'm glad I never stayed at the Hard Rock.
reviews.title: Worst Service Ever!

description: Hard Rock San Diego Hotel downtown is where VIP service meets urban-chic design with world-class dining and ultra-hip nightlife for an unforgettable experience that rocks.
